His actions included banning "inherently divisive concepts" such as critical race theory in schools, lifting mask mandates and vaccine requirements, and creating commissions to combat antisemitism and human trafficking. These orders were more controversial than those of recent predecessors. Lawsuits were brought against Youngkin's mask mandate repeal, and a federal judge later ruled that school districts could choose to require masking.
